structure.unit: COUNTIES, CITIES, AND OTHER LOCAL UNITS

law.text: Each settlement made by the county treasurer shall be approved by the fiscal court in open court, and shall, by order of the fiscal court, be recorded by the county clerk in a book kept for that purpose. The original shall be filed in the county clerk's office, and preserved as a record of the court. All statements, vouchers and other papers relating to the annual settlement shall be filed in the office of the county clerk, to be disposed of as the fiscal court directs.
law.history: Recodified 1942 Ky. Acts ch. 208, sec. 1, effective October 1, 1942, from Ky. Stat. secs. 933, 936.
